metadata.title: CVE-2016-8684 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The MagickMalloc function in magick/memory.c in GraphicsMagick 1.3.25allows remote attackers to have unspecified impact via a crafted image,which triggers a memory allocation failure and a "file truncation error forcorrupt file."

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8684` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.25-5
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.25-5
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.25-5
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.25-5
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.25-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.25-5').
